content.description: Powerful, body-tension moves culminate in a blind throw for a sharp crimp at the lip. Turn the lip, and then traverse right to downclimb on easier terrain.
content.location:
It is 15 feet to the right of

Hyperextension

.

content.description:
Sit start beginning on good holds, and make a few easy moves to reach the jugs in the roof. Get a good heel hook, and bring your right hand through to a crimp. Keep body tension, and reach to a hold on the lip of the roof. Pull the roof, and do the same finish as you would for

Hyperextension

.
content.location:
It is 10 feet to the right of

Hyperextension

.

content.description: This will get you pumped. Start on a jug under a low roof towards the left, and traverse up and to the right across the entire wall.
content.location: Follow the lip of the roof more or less.

content.description: The problem begins with a long reach to a pinch followed by a dynamic move to a sloped rail. This is the crux, but the difficulties aren't over yet. Turn the lip, and continue up the face, vertical at first, but eventually trending left. The terrain eases to about 5.6 towards the top, but be aware - it's a long way to the deck.
content.location: Begin in the deepest part of the overhang near the middle of the wall.

content.description:
Start as you would for

The Mill

, but instead of going left at the sharp jug, match on it, and throw your right hand up and right to an improbable geometric pinch. Figure out how to hit the sloper at the lip, and finish it off.
content.location:
It is 10 feet to the right of

Hyperextension

but left of

Synapse

.

content.description: Begin low on the same starting jug as the traverse. Move right on good holds then up and left on crimps through the roof. If you have the right stuff in you, the tall but easy topout climbing can be brained with cool-headed proficiency.
content.location: It is on the far left side of the wall under a small roof.
